sentences.en: After a recount, the challenger was proclaimed winner of the election.
sentences.cn: 在重新计票之后, 选务单位宣布挑战者赢得选举.

sentences.en: Bush: The election was close, but tonight after a count recount and yet another manual recount.
sentences.cn: 布什: 选举已经结束, 不过今天晚上在经过点票、重点,以及另一次人工重点之后.

sentences.en: Gore angered by decision to keep manual recount deadline.
sentences.cn: 戈尔阵营对维持人工计票做最后期限愤怒.

sentences.en: Having stated that Smith had a case, I must also recount that he sleeve.
sentences.cn: 说明了史密斯有道理的一面后, 我也应当指出,他气量小,常常怒形于色.

sentences.en: He then recounted the story of the interview for his first job.
sentences.cn: 他然后叙述了有关他第一份工作面试的故事。

sentences.en: If a result is close, any candidate may ask for a recount.
sentences.cn: 如果投票结果非常接近, 任何一名候选人都可以要求重新点票.

sentences.en: It remains only to recount the slender part which the British were able play.
sentences.cn: 至于英军所能起的微弱的作用,则有待后文补叙.

sentences.en: Mr. Mousavi and the other two candidates announced the recount wouldn't be acceptable to them.
sentences.cn: 穆萨维和其他两位候选人宣布,重新计票是他们不能接受的.

sentences.en: Recount My favour to thee and to thy mother . Behold!
sentences.cn: 你当记忆我所赐你和你母亲的恩典.

sentences.en: She wanted a recount. She couldn't believe that I had got more votes than her.
sentences.cn: 她想要重新计票。她不相信我比她得票多。

sentences.en: She was asked to recount the details of the conversation to the court.
sentences.cn: 她被要求向法庭陈述谈话细节。

sentences.en: Still had better be recount at the same time.
sentences.cn: 最好还是重新计算一边.

sentences.en: The announcement of the election recount caused a lot of noise.
sentences.cn: 选举重新计票结果的宣布引起了大量议论.

sentences.en: The defeated candidate demanded a recount.
sentences.cn: 落选的候选人要求重新计票。

sentences.en: They had to recount the votes.
sentences.cn: 他们不得不重新计算票数.

sentences.en: This text discussed novel < our humble soul > of recount strategy.
sentences.cn: 论述了小说《我们的卑微的灵魂》的叙事策略.

trans.tran_en: a second count of votes that happens in an election because the result was very close
to tell someone a story or describe a series of events
